oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Phase Variation of NadA in Invasive Neisseria meningitidis Isolates Impacts on Coverage Estimates for 4C-MenB, a MenB Vaccine
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Green, Luke R
Lucidarme, Jay
Dave, Neelam
Chan, Hannah
Clark, Stephen
Borrow, Ray
Bayliss, Christopher D.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: theme:invasion impact
theme:wikidata.org/entity/Q112148709
Neisseria meningitidis
invasive species
invasion impact
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A recombinant NadA protein is one of the four major protective antigens of 4C-MenB (Bexsero), a vaccine developed for serogroup B Neisseria meningitidis (MenB). The meningococcal antigen typing system (MATS) is utilized as a high-throughput assay for assessing the invasive MenB strain coverage of 4C-MenB.
